instruction: Given a newspaper title and content, re-format the document into a blog post.
input:
Newspaper Title: “The impact of COVID-19 on the economy”
Newspaper Content: 

The coronavirus pandemic has caused a major disruption to the global economy – many businesses have been hit hard by the associated lockdowns, and unemployment has risen sharply. It remains to be seen what the long-term implications of the crisis will be, but economists have warned that some sectors may take years to recover.
output:
The coronavirus pandemic has had a devastating impact on the global economy. With lockdowns in place, many businesses have been forced to shut their doors and an unprecedented number of people now find themselves out of work. 

Although the full extent of the economic damage caused by the pandemic will only become clear over time, economists have warned that some sectors may take years to recover. For this reason, it’s important to consider the short-term and long-term effects of the crisis and make plans now to mitigate the damage.

It is clear that the coronavirus pandemic has already had a significant impact on the economy, and it is likely that this impact will be felt for years to come. It’s up to all of us to work together to ensure that the economic damage caused by the pandemic is minimized as much as possible.

instruction: How can humans coexist with nature more harmoniously?
output: Humans can coexist with nature more harmoniously by recognizing the importance of environmental conservation, sustainable resource use and the interconnectedness of natural systems.  We can reduce our carbon footprints by using renewable energy sources, practicing water conservation, participating in recycling initiatives and conserving land through habitat protection. We can also educate ourselves and others on the importance of biodiversity and protection of endangered species. We can also incorporate more plants and trees into our lives, as well as make the effort to eat locally and support businesses that use sustainable practices.

instruction: How is a soufflé made?
output: A traditional French soufflé is made by combining egg yolks, butter, flour and a flavorful base like cheese, fruit or chocolate. The egg whites are whisked to form a meringue and then folded into the mixture. The mixture is poured into a greased and sugared pan, then baked until it has risen and the top is golden brown.

instruction: What are the four rules for exponents?

The four rules for exponents are:
1. Multiply the same base values with the same exponent,
2. Divide the same base values with the same exponent, 
3. Raise a power to a power,

instruction: Explain how the Drake Equation is used to estimate the number of extraterrestrial civilizations in the Milky Way galaxy.
output: The Drake Equation is an equation developed by radio astronomer Dr. Frank Drake in 1961. It is used to estimate the number of extraterrestrial civilizations in the Milky Way galaxy. The equation takes into account the factors of the rate of star formation, the average rate of planets that can potentially host life, the fraction of stars with planets that actually have life, the number of planets that develop intelligent life, the fraction of which would develop interstellar communication, and the length of time over which they could communicate. The equation is used to estimate the number of both extinct and extant extraterrestrial civilizations.

instruction: Construct a game plan for negotiating a job offer.
output: When negotiating a job offer, it is important to approach the conversation with a plan. Before the negotiations begin, determine your ideal outcome and set your limits. Gather research on salaries and benefits that are typical for the job you are applying for in your geographic location. During the negotiations, avoid “yes” or “no” answers, ask open-ended questions, remain calm and confident, show enthusiasm, be ready to compromise and don’t be afraid to pause if needed. Finally, once the negotiation process is finished, be sure to thank the employer and confirm the deal verbally.
